Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2010 07:34PM rcmc53 wrote: Thank you so much for the correct name of the med.  A friend went to the doc with my aunt today and called and told me the name of the med, but one of us obviously got it wrong.  So I looked up Tamoxifen and that seems to be the right one going by the description of how it works. Thanks again!

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2010 07:36PM rcmc53 wrote: Leah,  Thanks for the encouraging news about your Aunt.  I will pass this on to mine and hopefully we will have the opportunity to add years to her life as well.

Posts.Content: rcmc53 wrote: Please help.  My 87 year old aunt underwent a lumpectomy 3 weeks ago.  Today her physician has prescribed Tamamfloxin for her treatment.  I cannot find any information on the web about this medication and it's possible side effects.  Unfortunately, I am her closest of kin,but I live in California and she is in Texas.  This is all very new to us as she is the first in the family to deal with Breast Cancer.  If anyone can share more information with me about this medication we would greatly appreciate it.  We would also like to hear about other elderly survivors.  Thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 87 yr old with BC rcmc53 desertladyarizona2010
